newsitem.title: USA: Cargill Inc Q2 earnings rise.
newsitem.headline: Cargill Inc Q2 earnings rise.

text.p: Cargill Inc, the world's largest private commodities trader, said Wednesday its earnings for the fiscal 1997 second quarter ended November 30 were $307 million, up from $301 million a year ago.
Earnings for the first six months of the year were $486 million, down from $506 million a year ago, Cargill said.
All major segments of company operations were profitable during the quarter, Cargill said.
Commodity trading and processing operations showed substantial improvement over first quarter results, due largely to the gradual replenishment of world supplies of grains and oilseeds, Cargill said.
Financial activities continued to perform well, and industrial activities remained solidly profitable.
